intro: Seseli longifolium, commonly known as long-leaved seseli, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, white to greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Its slender stems and delicate appearance make it a notable species in its native habitat. It is often found in dry, open areas and is valued for its ornamental qualities.
